alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 8:40PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of east central Mineral and west central Missoula Counties through 915 PM MST... At 839 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking intense snow showers along a line extending from near Tarkio to 13 miles west of Alberton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-quarter mile or less and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Alberton, Tarkio, Ninemile, Lozeau, Huson, Quartz and Cyr. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 54 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH

area.areaDesc: Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys
